data.title: The legacy continues: 8 Secretariat descendants are racing in this year's Kentucky Derby
data.meta_description: Fifty years later, Secretariat is still royalty at the Kentucky Derby. His legendary Churchill Downs sprint will be challenged again Saturday.
data.text:
Fifty years after his Triple Crown triumph, Secretariat and his legacy still loom large over the Kentucky Derby.

His sub-2-minute sprint around the Churchill Downs track has been approached just once by the 49 other champions since 1973. The mark will be challenged again Saturday, 34 years since his death, by eight horses from his bloodline during the race's 149th running.

Secretariat's Kentucky Derby time is still undefeated

The Triple Crown is a combination of three races in a single season:

The Kentucky Derby at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Kentucky

The Preakness Stakes at Pimlico Race Course in Baltimore

The Belmont Stakes at Belmont Park in Elmont, New York

Secretariat, also known as Big Red, started his Triple Crown run 50 years ago when he finished the Kentucky Derby in 1:59.40. Among the jewels of his crown: Big Red went on to set records that still stand at the Preakness and Belmont.

Secretariat's margin of victory and time is even more remarkable when compared with the more than four dozen other winners since.

8 descendants of Secretariat are running in this year's Derby

This year, eight of the 20 horses competing in the 149th Run for the Roses are part of Big Red's lineage. All trace back to three of Secretariat's 660 offspring:

• Secrettame, born in 1978• Weekend Surprise, born in 1980• Medaille d'Or, born in 1976

Another horse from Secretariat's lineage, Wild On Ice, had qualified to run in this year's Derby, but he was euthanized the week before the race after a training accident.

Secretariat starting post at the Kentucky Derby is still one of the winningest

Secretariat's starting position toward the center of the field in the 1973 derby has proved a favorable one. The starting gate and how the horse responds to it can have a great influence on its performance and odds.

Fifty years ago, Secretariat started in Post 10, which has a good record. This spot boasts nine Derby winners, the second-highest among all gates, and 24 horses that finished in the money.

The only gate that has produced more champions is Post 5, with 10 Kentucky Derby winners.
